title: The Trump Impeachment Inquiry: Latest Updates
text:
The top diplomat in Ukraine is answering questions about what he described in a text message as a “crazy” quid pro quo.

William B. Taylor Jr., the United States ambassador to Ukraine, on Tuesday became the latest Trump administration official to make his way to Capitol Hill to offer his account to impeachment investigators as they search for answers about Mr. Trump’s pressure campaign on Ukraine.

Mr. Taylor is expected to be questioned about a series of text messages from September revealed by a former colleague, Kurt D. Volker, the former special envoy to Ukraine, in which Mr. Taylor wrote that he thought it was “crazy to withhold security assistance for help with a political campaign.”

The exchange appeared to suggest that the Trump administration was trying to use a $319 million package of aid to Ukraine as leverage to squeeze the nation’s president to open investigations that would boost Mr. Trump’s presidential campaign — and that Mr. Taylor was alarmed by the effort.
description: The top American diplomat in Ukraine is meeting behind closed doors with House impeachment investigators as the inquiry widens and President Trump rages against what he calls a ‘lynching.’
